means: 对手
竞争者
与…竞争
比得上某人
竞争
竞争的
[人名] 里瓦尔
rapid insurance valuation language 快速保险金额估算语言

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"竞争"之意。
means: compete ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指体育活动等活动中争取优胜的相互竞争，也可指为了自己的利益与他人竞争。
contend ： 指为战胜或击败对手进行不懈努力，强调拼搏。也可指口头上进行有对立情绪或严重分歧的争论。
contest ： 指为争夺土地、阵地、权力或荣誉等而展开的竞争。
rival ： 指在两方或多方的竞争或比赛中，谁都想战胜或比得上对手。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"相称，比得上，与……相比"之意。
means: match ： 指对手之间力量、强度、性能或利益等的较量或竞争。
equal ： 指在数量、价值或程度等方面已完全相等。
rival ： 指某人或某物在和对手竞争中，在能力、质量等方面都能与之相匹敌，都能比得上。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"对手，敌手"之意。
means: opponent ： 最常用词，通常指在争论、辩论、竞选或竞赛以及其它各种矛盾冲突中站在对立面的"对手"或"敌手"。
competitor ： 指为同一目标或目的竞争者，一般无感情色彩。
enemy ： 多指充满敌意的仇敌。
foe ： 语气较强，多用于书面文字和诗歌中。指不仅敌对，而且很危险，怀有很深的敌意。
rival ： 指与某人目标一致而想赶上或超过他的人，匹敌者。

sentence.Network_en: Leaders of some rival factions signed a peace agreement last week.
sentence.Network_cn: 上周，一些敌对派系领导人签订了和平协议。

sentence.Network_en: The national tragedy of rival groups killing each other continued throughout 1990.
sentence.Network_cn: 敌对派别相互残杀的国家悲剧1990年全年都在上演。

sentence.Network_en: He polled four times as many votes as his rival.
sentence.Network_cn: 他得到的选票数量是竞选对手的4倍。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin rivalis, originally in the sense 'person using the same stream as another', from rivus 'stream'

entry.def: Your rival is a person, business, or organization who you are competing or fighting against in the same area or for the same things.

example.ex: The world champion finished more than two seconds ahead of his nearest rival...
example.tran: 世界冠军领先第二名2秒多钟到达终点。

example.ex: He eliminated his rivals in a brutal struggle for power...
example.tran: 他在一场残酷的权力争斗中将对手一一铲除。

entry.tran: 没有敌手;独一无二;无人能及
entry.def: If you say that someone or something has no rivals or is without rival, you mean that it is best of its type.

example.ex: ...a wonderfully fragrant wine which has no rivals in the Rhone...
example.tran: 在罗纳河地区独一无二的无比香醇的葡萄酒

example.ex: He is a pastry chef without rival.

entry.tran: 能与…媲美;与…匹敌;与…不分高低
entry.def: If you say that one thing rivals another, you mean that they are both of the same standard or quality.

example.ex: Cassette recorders cannot rival the sound quality of CDs...
example.tran: 卡式磁带录音机的音质无法和CD相媲美。

example.ex: An epidemic to rival that which killed 26,000 in 1989 may hit the UK.
example.tran: 一种流行病可能会袭击英国，其危害程度不亚于1989年导致26,000人丧生的疾病。

means.word_mean: 1. the contestant you hope to defeat;

sentences.sentence: "he wanted to know what the competition was doing"

means.word_mean: 1. be equal to in quality or ability;

sentences.sentence: "Your performance doesn't even touch that of your colleagues"
"Her persistence and ambition only matches that of her parents"

means.word_mean: 2. be the rival of, be in competition with;

sentences.sentence: "we are rivaling for first place in the race"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词"人,物,状态"; 2. 地方; 3. 表形容词,"……的"

clinic临床+al……的→adj.临床的,病房用的
con共同+gen出生+it+al……的→与生俱来
continent大陆+al……的→adj.大陆的,大陆性的

Sentence.sentence: Avis, a car-hire firm, has a share in a sharing rival.
His insistence on putting users first, and focusing on elegance and simplicity, has become deep-rooted in his own company, and is spreading to rival firms too
Both may fail when confronting experienced rivals.
Several opponents have recently emerged, ranging from rival tech giants such as Microsoft and Amazon to small bodies representing authors and publishers across the world.
In Einstein's day, there were only a few thousand physicists worldwide, and the theoreticians who could intellectually rival Einstein probably would fit into a streetcar with seats to spare.

sentences.cn: 他击败了他的竞争对手。

means.word_mean: 与…竞争, 与…匹敌，比得上

sentences.en: None of us can rival him in strength.
The sunset rivalled the sunrise in beauty.
sentences.cn: 日落与日出的景色一样美。

jushi.english: As a book of reference for students of English, this dictionary is without a rival.
jushi.chinese: 作为英语系学生的参考书,这部辞典是无与伦比的。

jushi.english: None of us can rival him in strength.
